title: Who is Dev Griffin, the celeb who left Strictly Come Dancing last night?
text:
Dev Griffin’s exit from Strictly has caused controversy (Picture: BBC)

Strictly Come Dancing 2019 has sparked outrage among its viewers after DJ Dev Griffin became the third celebrity to leave the dancefloor on Sunday night.

Dev, who partnered Dianne Buswell in the series, had been heavily tipped to make the latter stages of the competition after scoring highly in the first weeks of the show – but came unstuck with his cha cha over the weekend, ultimately losing out to Viscountess Emma Weymouth in the dance-off.

All of which has led to a strong reaction after Dianne was left sobbing on the dancefloor – later posting an emotional tribute to Dev on social media – while furious fans have threatened to boycott the show, also claiming they were unable to get through on phonelines to vote for the couple.

It’s certainly left a lot of people upset – but just who is Dev and how is he best known away from the ballroom?

Here’s what you need to know…

Who is Dev Griffin and how is he best known?

Dev has been at Radio 1 for a decade (Picture: Getty Images)

Dev Griffin is 34 years old and grew up in North London.

He is best known as a DJ and presenter, beginning his radio career in 2000 when he was just 16 on the pirate station Freek FM.

However he landed his first TV job, as co-host of the kids’ TV show Smile, while he was still studying for his A’Levels.

Dev appeared on the CBBC show alongside co-host Fearne Cotton as well as friend and fellow DJ Reggie Yates – before they landed their own show on BBC Radio 1Xtra, the Reg and Dev Show.

He went on to front several shows on 1Xtra, flying solo since Reggie left the station in late 2004 – including the weekend morning shows, Saturday afternoons and the early morning show on weekdays.

Dev had a harrowing time on Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins (Picture: WENN)

Dev moved to Radio 1 in 2009 and currently hosts the weekend breakfast show – and during his time with them he has also fronted the weekday early show, as well as sitting in for the likes of Nick Grimshaw, Greg James and Scott Mills.

Strictly isn’t his only brush with celeb reality TV either – with Dev also appearing on Celebrity SAS: Who Dares Wins earlier this year, quitting the show after undergoing a harrowing four-hour interrogation session which left him in tears.

What routines did he perform on Strictly?

Dev kicked off his Strictly journey with a foxtrot in week one which saw him and Dianne pick up an impressive 30 points.

They did almost as well in week two after nabbing 27 for their jive, while Movie Week saw the pair deliver the first Couple’s Choice routine of the series, which landed them a total of 36 points, finishing second behind Kelvin Fletcher and Oti Mabuse.

Strictly Come Dancing continues on BBC One next Saturday night at 6.40pm.
